titleStmt.title: William Munday et al. to Unknown
CWG9292

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: The undersigned citizens of Clark County, Kentucky, would respectfully represent to your Excellency, that at the May Term 1860, of the Clark Circuit Court, Mr William Goosey Jr Confessed judgment in two cases for $2000 each and costs, for Gaming which occured about 3 years since, and which games were played for 5 cents for amusement We would state that Mr Goosey is a poor but highly respectable young man, and deeply regrets that he violated the Law, and promises never to do so again. We beg that your Excellency may remit such portions of the Fines as in your power as we think it would not be detrimental to the public good but on the contrary inspire Mr Goosey & his associates with a resolution & purpose not again to violate the Law,

William Munday
James Munday
O. P. Evans
A N Bush
Thos Gaines
Geo M Jackson
S. W. Besch
David Brown
W. W. Storm
S H Cochran
John P Hukill
